issue: Only several liability among affiliates, no joint liability, i.e., no customer affiliate will be liable for actions/omissions/breaches of another
alt_text: Customer Full Legal Name:Customer Address:This Master Subscription Agreement is between salesforce.com, inc., a Delaware corporation with its principal place of business at Salesforce Tower, 415 Mission Street, 3rd Floor, San Francisco, California 94105 (“SFDC”) and the customer named above. This Agreement is effective as of the last date beneath the parties’ signatures below (the “Effective Date”). Each Customer Affiliate executing an Order Form hereunder will be solely liable for obligations incurred by it under this Agreement in connection with such Order Form, and no other Customer Affiliate will be liable for such obligations; provided, however, that if Services purchased by multiple Customer Affiliates use the same logically separated instance of a given Service (each instance an “Org”), any suspension of any such Services as permitted under this Agreement will result in the suspension of Services for the entire Org, and any such suspension or termination shall not be a breach of this clause.The parties agree as follows:

issue: Add detailed description of support; Option 1: Standard Success Plan by reference
alt_text: SFDC will (a) make the Services and Content available to Customer pursuant to this Agreement and the applicable Order Forms and Documentation, (b) provide the Standard Success Plan to Customer's applicable Users for the applicable Services, at no additional charge, in accordance with the descriptions at https://www.salesforce.com/company/legal/agreements. (c) use commercially reasonable efforts to make the online Services available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, except for: (i) planned downtime (of which SFDC shall give advance electronic notice), and (ii) any unavailability caused by circumstances beyond SFDC’s reasonable control, including, for example, an act of God, act of government, flood, fire, earthquake, civil unrest, act of terror, strike or other labor problem (other than one involving SFDC employees), Internet service provider failure or delay, Non-SFDC Application, or denial of service attack, and (d) provide the Services in accordance with laws and government regulations applicable to SFDC’s provision of its Services to its customers generally (i.e., without regard for Customer’s particular use of the Services), and subject to Customer’s use of the Services in accordance with this Agreement, the Documentation and the applicable Order Form.

alt_text: SFDC will (a) make the Services and Content available to Customer pursuant to this Agreement, and the applicable Order Forms and Documentation, (b) provide applicable SFDC standard support for the Services to Customer at no additional charge, and/or upgraded support if purchased, (c) use commercially reasonable efforts to make the online Services available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, except for: (i) planned downtime (of which SFDC shall give advance electronic notice), and (ii) any unavailability caused by circumstances beyond SFDC’s reasonable control, including, for example, an act of God, act of government, flood, fire, earthquake, civil unrest, act of terror, strike or other labor problem (other than one involving SFDC employees), Internet service provider failure or delay, Non-SFDC Application, or denial of service attack, and (d) provide the Services in accordance with laws and government regulations applicable to SFDC’s provision of its Services to its customers generally (i.e., without regard for Customer’s particular use of the Services), and subject to Customer’s use of the Services in accordance with this Agreement, the Documentation and the applicable Order Form. At Customer’s written request, but no more than once annually, and subject to the confidentiality provisions of the Agreement, SFDC will provide Customer with an Executive Summary of the most recent penetration testing that has been performed on the applicable Services.

issue: Customer wants us to agree that we will “maintain commercially reasonable or industry standard administrative, physical, and technical safeguards for protection of the security, confidentiality and integrity of Customer Data "
alt_text: SFDC will maintain commercially reasonable administrative, physical, and technical safeguards for protection of the security, confidentiality and integrity of Customer Data, as described in the Documentation. Those safeguards will include, but will not be limited to, measures designed to prevent unauthorized access to or disclosure of Customer Data (other than by Customer or Users). The terms of the data processing addendum attached as an exhibit hereto ("DPA") are hereby incorporated by reference and shall apply to the extent Customer Data includes Personal Data, as defined in the DPA. To the extent Personal Data from the European Economic Area (EEA), the United Kingdom and Switzerland are processed by SFDC, its Processor Binding Corporate Rules, the EU-US and/or Swiss-US Privacy Shield, and/or the Standard Contractual Clauses shall apply, as further set forth in the DPA. For the purposes of the Standard Contractual Clauses, Customer and its applicable Affiliates are each the data exporter, and Customer's execution of this Agreement, and an applicable Affiliate's execution of an Order Form, shall be treated as its execution of the Standard Contractual Clauses and appendices. Upon request by Customer made within 30 days after the effective date of termination or expiration of this Agreement, SFDC will make Customer Data available to Customer for export or download as provided in the Documentation. After such 30-day period, SFDC will have no obligation to maintain or provide any Customer Data, and as provided in the Documentation will thereafter delete or destroy all copies of Customer Data in its systems or otherwise in its possession or control, unless legally prohibited.

issue: Customer wants to delete the part of Section 2.2 incorporating the DPA and Model Clauses because they don’t think it applies to them.
alt_text: SFDC will maintain appropriate administrative, physical, and technical safeguards for protection of the security, confidentiality and integrity of Customer Data, as described in the Documentation. Those safeguards will include, but will not be limited to, measures designed to prevent unauthorized access to or disclosure of Customer Data (other than by Customer or Users). Customer acknowledges that SFDC has made available a data processing addendum at http://www.sfdcstatic.com/assets/pdf/misc/data-processing-addendum.pdf ("DPA") that contains additional terms related to Customer Data (to the extent such Customer Data includes Personal Data, as defined in the DPA) and that Customer may choose to execute such DPA at anytime in accordance with the section titled "How to Execute this DPA" in such DPA. Customer further acknowledges that such terms between the parties may be required for compliance with certain applicable Data Protection Laws and Regulations (as defined in the DPA), including in the event Customer is subject to the European Union's General Data Protection Regulation or submits or instructs SFDC to process Personal Data from the European Economic Area (EEA) and Switzerland as part of the Services. To the extent that, during the Term, Customer (i) submits or instructs SFDC to process Personal Data from the EEA and/or Switzerland as part of the Services or (ii) is otherwise required to have in place a data processing addendum or data protection terms similar to what is provided in the DPA in compliance with applicable Data Protection Laws and Regulations, Customer agrees to immediately execute the DPA in accordance with the section titled "How to Execute this DPA" in such DPA, and hold SFDC harmless for any damages arising out of or related to the lack of a data processing addendum or similar data protection terms between the parties as required by any such applicable Data Protection Laws and Regulations. Upon request by Customer made within 30 days after the effective date of termination or expiration of this Agreement, SFDC will make Customer Data available to Customer for export or download as provided in the Documentation. After such 30-day period, SFDC will have no obligation to maintain or provide any Customer Data, and as provided in the Documentation will thereafter delete or destroy all copies of Customer Data in its systems or otherwise in its possession or control, unless legally prohibited.

issue: Post-termination transition assistance
alt_text: SFDC will maintain appropriate administrative, physical, and technical safeguards for protection of the security, confidentiality and integrity of Customer Data, as described in the Documentation. Those safeguards will include, but will not be limited to, measures designed to prevent unauthorized access to or disclosure of Customer Data (other than by Customer or Users). The terms of the data processing addendum at http://www.sfdcstatic.com/assets/pdf/misc/data-processing-addendum.pdf ("DPA") are hereby incorporated by reference and shall apply to the extent Customer Data includes Personal Data, as defined in the DPA. To the extent Personal Data from the European Economic Area (EEA), the United Kingdom and Switzerland are processed by SFDC, its Processor Binding Corporate Rules, the EU-US and/or Swiss-US Privacy Shield, and/or the Standard Contractual Clauses shall apply, as further set forth in the DPA. For the purposes of the Standard Contractual Clauses, Customer and its applicable Affiliates are each the data exporter, and Customer's execution of this Agreement, and an applicable Affiliate's execution of an Order Form, shall be treated as its execution of the Standard Contractual Clauses and appendices. Upon request by Customer made within 30 days after the effective date of termination or expiration of this Agreement, SFDC will make Customer Data available to Customer for export or download as provided in the Documentation. After such 30-day period, SFDC will have no obligation to maintain or provide any Customer Data, and as provided in the Documentation will thereafter delete or destroy all copies of Customer Data in its systems or otherwise in its possession or control, unless legally prohibited. If either party elects not to renew any subscription term, and termination of such subscription would result in termination of this Agreement under the "Term of Agreement" section, then upon request by Customer made 15 or more days before the termination date, SFDC shall continue to provide the Services for an additional 90 days after the termination date (the "Transition Period") under the same terms and subject to a 10% price increase as applicable to the pricing as applied immediately before the termination date, subject to Customer's execution before the termination date of an Order Form for such continued Services. Any assistance to be provided by SFDC to Customer besides the Services shall be subject to the parties' entering into a professional services agreement and statement of work. Notwithstanding any termination of this Agreement under this Section, the terms of this Agreement shall continue to govern SFDC's provision of the Services during the Transition Period as if it had not been terminated. The foregoing shall not apply in the event of a termination of this Agreement by SFDC for cause under the "Termination" section.

issue: Customer wants SFDC to comply with NIST Special Publication 800-88 with respect to Customer Data destruction
alt_text: SFDC will maintain appropriate administrative, physical, and technical safeguards for protection of the security, confidentiality and integrity of Customer Data, as described in the Documentation. Those safeguards will include, but will not be limited to, measures designed to prevent unauthorized access to or disclosure of Customer Data (other than by Customer or Users). The terms of the data processing addendum at http://www.sfdcstatic.com/assets/pdf/misc/data-processing-addendum.pdf ("DPA") are hereby incorporated by reference and shall apply to the extent Customer Data includes Personal Data, as defined in the DPA. To the extent Personal Data from the European Economic Area (EEA), the United Kingdom and Switzerland are processed by SFDC, its Processor Binding Corporate Rules, the EU-US and/or Swiss-US Privacy Shield, and/or the Standard Contractual Clauses shall apply, as further set forth in the DPA. For the purposes of the Standard Contractual Clauses, Customer and its applicable Affiliates are each the data exporter, and Customer's execution of this Agreement, and an applicable Affiliate's execution of an Order Form, shall be treated as its execution of the Standard Contractual Clauses and appendices. Upon request by Customer made within 30 days after the effective date of termination or expiration of this Agreement, SFDC will make Customer Data available to Customer for export or download as provided in the Documentation. After such 30-day period, SFDC will have no obligation to maintain or provide any Customer Data, and as provided in the Documentation will thereafter delete or destroy all copies of Customer Data in its systems or otherwise in its possession or control, unless legally prohibited. With respect to the Salesforce Services, SFDC shall destroy all Customer Data contained on any media in SFDC's datacenter prior to such media leaving the datacenter in accordance with the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Special Publication 800-88 or a standard that is not materially less protective as of the Effective Date. Upon customer request, SFDC will provide written documentation of its adherence to such standards.
standard: SFDC will maintain appropriate administrative, physical, and technical safeguards for protection of the security, confidentiality and integrity of Customer Data, as described in the Documentation. Those safeguards will include, but will not be limited to, measures designed to prevent unauthorized access to or disclosure of Customer Data (other than by Customer or Users). The terms of the data processing addendum at http://www.sfdcstatic.com/assets/pdf/misc/data-processing-addendum.pdf ("DPA") are hereby incorporated by reference and shall apply to the extent Customer Data includes Personal Data, as defined in the DPA. To the extent Personal Data from the European Economic Area (EEA), the United Kingdom and Switzerland are processed by SFDC, its Processor Binding Corporate Rules, the EU-US and/or Swiss-US Privacy Shield, and/or the Standard Contractual Clauses shall apply, as further set forth in the DPA. For the purposes of the Standard Contractual Clauses, Customer and its applicable Affiliates are each the data exporter, and Customer's execution of this Agreement, and an applicable Affiliate's execution of an Order Form, shall be treated as its execution of the Standard Contractual Clauses and appendices. Upon request by Customer made within 30 days after the effective date of termination or expiration of this Agreement, SFDC will make Customer Data available to Customer for export or download as provided in the Documentation. After such 30-day period, SFDC will have no obligation to maintain or provide any Customer Data, and as provided in the Documentation will thereafter delete or destroy all copies of Customer Data in its systems or otherwise in its possession or control, unless legally prohibited. With respect to the Salesforce Services, SFDC shall destroy all Customer Data contained on any media in SFDC's datacenter prior to such media leaving the datacenter in accordance with the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Special Publication 800-88 or a standard that is not materially less protective as of the Effective Date. Upon customer request, SFDC will provide written documentation of its adherence to such standards.

issue: Delete this clause because it may not encompass all SFDC pricing models.  For example, there may be training courses or other products not purchased as subscriptions
alt_text: Unless otherwise provided in the applicable Order Form or Documentation, (a) Services and access to Content are purchased as subscriptions for the term stated in the applicable Order Form, (b) subscriptions may be added during a subscription term at the same pricing as the underlying subscription pricing, prorated for the portion of that subscription term remaining at the time the subscriptions are added, and (c) any added subscriptions will terminate on the same date as the underlying subscriptions. Customer agrees that its purchases are not contingent on the delivery of any future functionality or features, or dependent on any oral or written public comments made by SFDC regarding future functionality or features. For clarity, Services and Content may be purchased on a basis other than subscriptions if expressly so specified in the applicable Order Form.

issue: Customer wants clarity as to what price they will have to pay for going over the usage limits
alt_text: Services and Content are subject to usage limits specified in Order Forms and Documentation. If Customer exceeds a contractual usage limit, SFDC may work with Customer to seek to reduce Customer’s usage so that it conforms to that limit. If, notwithstanding SFDC’s efforts, Customer is unable or unwilling to abide by a contractual usage limit, Customer will execute an Order Form for additional quantities of the applicable Services or Content promptly upon SFDC’s request, and/or pay any invoice for excess usage in accordance with the “Invoicing and Payment” section below at a price not to exceed SFDC’s then-current list price for excess usage of the applicable Service, unless otherwise agreed by the parties in writing.
standard: Services and Content are subject to usage limits specified in Order Forms and Documentation. issue: Define clearer process for addressing situations where customer exceeds quantity limit
alt_text: Services and Content are subject to usage limits specified in Order Forms and Documentation. If Customer exceeds a contractual usage limit, SFDC may so notify Customer in writing (email acceptable). If SFDC provides such notice and Customer does not bring its usage within the contractual limit within 10 business days of such notice, SFDC may so notify Customer again. If SFDC, in accordance with this Section, notifies Customer three times within any 90-day period that it has exceeded a contractual usage limit, Customer will execute an Order Form for additional quantities of the applicable Services or Content promptly upon SFDC’s request, and/or pay any invoice for excess usage in accordance with the “Invoicing and Payment” section below.

If SFDC, in accordance with this Section, notifies Customer three times within any 90-day period that it has exceeded a contractual usage limit, Customer will execute an Order Form for additional quantities of the applicable Services or Content promptly upon SFDC’s request, and/or pay any invoice for excess usage in accordance with the “Invoicing and Payment” section below.

issue: Customer is concerned SFDC will terminate in the event of exceeding usage limits
alt_text: Services and Content are subject to usage limits specified in Order Forms and Documentation. If, notwithstanding SFDC’s efforts, Customer is unable or unwilling to abide by a contractual usage limit, Customer will execute an Order Form for additional quantities of the applicable Services or Content promptly upon SFDC’s request, and/or pay any invoice for excess usage in accordance with the “Invoicing and Payment” section below.  If Customer pays such fees for the corresponding excess usage in accordance with this paragraph 3.2, such payment will be SFDC’s sole and exclusive remedy for the excess usage provided that the excess usage (i) was not committed in bad faith and (ii) did not result from a violation by Customer of any other terms of the Agreement, the Documentation or the applicable Order Form

issue: Strike “be responsible for Users’ compliance with this Agreement, Documentation and Order Forms"
alt_text: Customer will (a) be responsible for Users’ compliance with Customer’s obligations under the remainder of this “Customer Responsibilities” section, the “Usage Restrictions” and “External-Facing Services” sections below, the Documentation and Order Forms; (b) be responsible for the accuracy, quality and legality of Customer Data, the means by which Customer acquired Customer Data, and the interoperation of any Non-SFDC Applications with which Customer uses Services or Content, (c) use commercially reasonable efforts to prevent unauthorized access to or use of Services and Content, and notify SFDC promptly of any such unauthorized access or use, and (d) use Services and Content only in accordance with this Agreement, Documentation, the Acceptable Use and External Facing Services Policy at https://www.salesforce.com/ company/legal/agreements.jsp, Order Forms and applicable laws and government regulations. Any use of the Services in breach of the foregoing by Customer or Users that in SFDC’s judgment threatens the security, integrity or availability of SFDC’s services, may result in SFDC’s immediate suspension of the Services, however SFDC will use commercially reasonable efforts under the circumstances to provide Customer with notice and an opportunity to remedy such violation or threat prior to any such suspension.

Affiliates, unless expressly stated otherwise in an Order Form or the Documentation, (b) sell, resell, license, sublicense, distribute, make available, rent or lease any Service or Content, or include any Service or Content in a service bureau or outsourcing offering, (c) use a Service or Non-SFDC Application to store or transmit infringing, libelous, or otherwise unlawful or tortious material, or to store or transmit material in violation of third-party privacy rights, (d) use a Service or Non-SFDC Application to store or transmit Malicious Code, (e) interfere with or disrupt the integrity or performance of any Service or third-party data contained therein, (f) attempt to gain unauthorized access to any Service or Content or its related systems or networks, (g) permit direct or indirect access to or use of any Services or Content in a way that circumvents a contractual usage limit, or use any Services to access or use any of SFDC intellectual property except as permitted under this Agreement, an Order Form, or the Documentation, (h) modify, copy, or create derivative works based on a Service or any part, feature, function or user interface thereof, (i) copy Content except as functions or graphics of the Service, or (4) determining whether the Services are within the scope of any patent.

issue: Apply to all products
alt_text: SFDC may notify Customer of material changes to the Documentation through release notes provided with major new releases of the applicable Services, provided, to the extent SFDC does not notify Customer of material changes to Documentation for any Services, then any material obligation or restriction imposed on Customer by a Documentation update will not take effect for Customer until Customer’s next purchase of an add-on subscription to its existing subscription to the applicable Service or the subscription renewal date for the applicable Service, whichever is earlier.
standard: SFDC may notify Customer of material changes to the Documentation through release notes provided with major new releases of the applicable Services, provided, to the extent SFDC does not notify Customer of material changes to Documentation for any Services, then any material obligation or restriction imposed on Customer by a Documentation update will not take effect for Customer until Customer’s next purchase of an add-on subscription to its existing subscription to the applicable Service or the subscription renewal date for the applicable Service, whichever is earlier.

clause_title: Removal of Content and Non-SFDC Applications
issue: Customer wants the right to terminate and/or receive a credit or refund if we remove Content or a Non-SFDC Application pursuant to this clause; Option 1
alt_text: If Customer receives notice that Content or a Non-SFDC Application must be removed, modified and/or disabled to avoid violating applicable law, third-party rights, or the Acceptable Use and External Facing Services Policy, Customer will promptly do so. If Customer does not take required action in accordance with the above, SFDC may disable the applicable Content, Service and/or Non-SFDC Application until the potential violation is resolved. If requested by SFDC, Customer shall confirm such deletion and discontinuance of use in writing and SFDC shall be authorized to provide a copy of such confirmation to any such third party claimant or governmental authority, as applicable. In addition, if SFDC is required by any third party rights holder to remove Content, or receives information that Content provided to Customer may violate applicable law or third-party rights, SFDC may discontinue Customer’s access to Content through the Services. :  If SFDC requests removal of, or removes, Content under this Section and such would render the applicable Services substantially unusable, then Customer may terminate its subscription to the affected Services upon 30 days’ written notice to SFDC, and in such event SFDC will refund to Customer any prepaid fees covering the remainder of the term of all terminated subscriptions after the effective date of termination.

issue: Customer wants to say that it isn’t required to buy non-SFDC products or services in order to use the Services
alt_text: SFDC or third parties may make available (for example, through a Marketplace or otherwise) third-party products or services, including, for example, Non-SFDC Applications and implementation and other consulting services. Any acquisition by Customer of such products or services, and any exchange of data between Customer and any non-SFDC provider, product or service is solely between Customer and the applicable non-SFDC provider. SFDC does not warrant or support Non-SFDC Applications or other non-SFDC products or services, whether or not they are designated by SFDC as “certified” or otherwise, unless expressly provided otherwise in an Order Form. SFDC is not responsible for any disclosure, modification or deletion of Customer Data resulting from access by such Non-SFDC Application or its provider. Unless otherwise specified in an applicable Order Form for a particular Service, and subject to the “Integration with Non-SFDC Applications” section below, as of the Effective Date no purchase of non-SFDC products or services is required to use the Services except a supported computing device, operating system, web browser and Internet connection.
standard: SFDC or third parties may make available (for example, through a Marketplace or otherwise) third-party products or services, including, for example, Non-SFDC Applications and implementation and other consulting services. Any acquisition by Customer of such products or services, and any exchange of data between Customer and any non-SFDC provider, product or service is solely between Customer and the applicable non-SFDC provider. SFDC does not warrant or support Non-SFDC Applications or other non-SFDC products or services, whether or not they are designated by SFDC as “certified” or otherwise, unless expressly provided otherwise in an Order Form. SFDC is not responsible for any disclosure, modification or deletion of Customer Data resulting from access by such Non-SFDC Application or its provider. Unless otherwise specified in an applicable Order Form for a particular Service, and subject to the “Integration with Non-SFDC Applications” section below, as of the Effective Date no purchase of non-SFDC products or services is required to use the Services except a supported computing device, operating system, web browser and Internet connection.

issue: Provide refund if SFDC ceases to make non-SFDC related Service features available
alt_text: The Services may contain features designed to interoperate with Non-SFDC Applications.  SFDC cannot guarantee the continued availability of such Service features, and may cease providing them without entitling Customer to any refund, credit, or other compensation, if for example and without limitation, the provider of a Non-SFDC Application ceases to make the Non-SFDC Application available for interoperation with the corresponding Service features in a manner acceptable to SFDC. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if Customer subscribes to a Service, which would be rendered substantially unusable due to the unavailability of a Non-SFDC Application platform (e.g., Twitter as to Social Studio), and such platform is unavailable so as to render Customer’s subscription for such Services substantially unusable in the same manner to SFDC’s customers of the same Services generally for a period of 10 consecutive days, Customer may terminate its subscription to the affected Services upon 5 days’ written notice to SFDC, and in such event SFDC will refund to Customer any prepaid fees covering the remainder of the term of all terminated subscriptions after the effective date of termination.

issue: Allow customer to withhold as required by law
alt_text: SFDC's fees do not include any taxes, levies, duties or similar governmental assessments of any nature, including, for example, value-added, sales, use or withholding taxes, assessable by any jurisdiction whatsoever (collectively, “Taxes”). Customer is responsible for paying all Taxes associated with its purchases hereunder. If SFDC has the legal obligation to pay or collect Taxes for which Customer is responsible under this section, SFDC will invoice Customer and Customer will pay that amount unless Customer provides SFDC with a valid tax exemption certificate authorized by the appropriate taxing authority. For clarity, SFDC is solely responsible for taxes assessable against it based on its income, property and employees. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Customer or the designated withholding agent in accordance with appropriate regulations may deduct from the fees payable hereunder any taxes that it is required by applicable law to withhold. Customer shall provide, or shall cause its withholding agent to provide, reasonable cooperation to SFDC in claiming any corresponding U.S. tax credits, including without limitation by providing to SFDC the withholding tax certificate issued in accordance with applicable law or, if applicable, other customer certified withholding tax document in accordance with applicable law.
standard: SFDC's fees do not include any taxes, levies, duties or similar governmental assessments of any nature, including, for example, value-added, sales, use or withholding taxes, assessable by any jurisdiction whatsoever (collectively, “Taxes”). Customer is responsible for paying all Taxes associated with its purchases hereunder. If SFDC has the legal obligation to pay or collect Taxes for which Customer is responsible under this section, SFDC will invoice Customer and Customer will pay that amount unless Customer provides SFDC with a valid tax exemption certificate authorized by the appropriate taxing authority. For clarity, SFDC is solely responsible for taxes assessable against it based on its income, property and employees. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Customer or the designated withholding agent in accordance with appropriate regulations may deduct from the fees payable hereunder any taxes that it is required by applicable law to withhold. Customer shall provide, or shall cause its withholding agent to provide, reasonable cooperation to SFDC in claiming any corresponding U.S. tax credits, including without limitation by providing to SFDC the withholding tax certificate issued in accordance with applicable law or, if applicable, other customer certified withholding tax document in accordance with applicable law.

issue: State that Customer owns Customer Data and/or Non-SFDC Applications it creates
alt_text: Customer grants SFDC, its Affiliates and applicable contractors a worldwide, limited-term license to host, copy, use, transmit, and display Customer Data, and any Non-SFDC Applications and program code created by or for Customer using a Service or for use by Customer with the Services, and Customer Data, each as necessary for SFDC to provide and ensure proper operation of the Services and associated systems in accordance with this Agreement. If Customer chooses to use a Non-SFDC Application with a Service, Customer grants SFDC permission to allow the Non-SFDC Application and its provider to access Customer Data as required for the interoperation of that Non-SFDC Application with the Service. Subject to the limited licenses granted herein, SFDC acquires no right, title or interest from Customer or its licensors under this Agreement in or to any Customer Data, Non-SFDC Application or such program code. As between Customer and SFDC, Customer owns all intellectual property rights in its Customer Data, in the program code created by Customer, and in Customer’s Non-SFDC Applications subject to SFDC’s and its Content providers’ reservation of rights in and to the Services and Content as set forth herein

issue: Request return/destruction of Confidential Information; Option 1
alt_text: “Confidential Information” means all information disclosed by a party (“Disclosing Party”) to the other party (“Receiving Party”), whether orally or in writing, that is designated as confidential or that reasonably should be understood to be confidential given the nature of the information and the circumstances of disclosure. Confidential Information of Customer includes Customer Data; Confidential Information of SFDC includes the Services and Content; and Confidential Information of each party includes the terms and conditions of this Agreement and all Order Forms (including pricing), as well as business and marketing plans, technology and technical information, product plans and designs, and business processes disclosed by such party. However, Confidential Information does not include any information that (i) is or becomes generally known to the public without breach of any obligation owed to the Disclosing Party, (ii) was known to the Receiving Party prior to its disclosure by the Disclosing Party without breach of any obligation owed to the Disclosing Party, (iii) is received from a third party without breach of any obligation owed to the Disclosing Party, or (iv) was independently developed by the Receiving Party. For the avoidance of doubt, the non-disclosure obligations set forth in this “Confidentiality” section apply to Confidential Information exchanged between the parties in connection with the evaluation of additional SFDC services.  Except with respect to Customer Data (the return of which is governed by the “Protection of Customer Data” section), upon request the Receiving Party shall promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party in the possession or control of the Receiving Party.

For the avoidance of doubt, the non-disclosure obligations set forth in this “Confidentiality” section apply to Confidential Information exchanged between the parties in connection with the evaluation of additional SFDC services.

issue: Require Receiving Party to limit any disclosure to the minimum necessary to comply with the order, or to that which the Receiving Party’s counsel advises is required
alt_text: The Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party to the extent compelled by law to do so, provided the Receiving Party gives the Disclosing Party prior notice of the compelled disclosure (to the extent legally permitted) and reasonable assistance, at the Disclosing Party's cost, if the Disclosing Party wishes to contest the disclosure. The Receiving Party will use commercially reasonable efforts to limit any such disclosure to the minimum it reasonably believes [ok to add if necessary: upon advice of counsel] is required to comply with the disclosure order, with recognition that SFDC is unable to isolate different types of Customer Data within a Customer’s Org. If the Receiving Party is compelled by law to disclose the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information as part of a civil proceeding to which the Disclosing Party is a party, and the Disclosing Party is not contesting the disclosure, the Disclosing Party will reimburse the Receiving Party for its reasonable cost of compiling and providing secure access to that Confidential Information.

issue: Customer wants language that addresses Litigation hold of Customer Data
alt_text: The Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party to the extent compelled by law to do so, provided the Receiving Party gives the Disclosing Party prior notice of the compelled disclosure (to the extent legally permitted) and reasonable assistance, at the Disclosing Party's cost, if the Disclosing Party wishes to contest the disclosure. If the Receiving Party is compelled by law to disclose the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information as part of a civil proceeding to which the Disclosing Party is a party, and the Disclosing Party is not contesting the disclosure, the Disclosing Party will reimburse the Receiving Party for its reasonable cost of compiling and providing secure access to that Confidential Information. In the event Customer does not have access to certain of its Customer Data, SFDC will reasonably cooperate with Customer to provide access to such Customer Data at Customer's expense as it relates to pending or anticipated litigation involving Customer or a government or internal investigation of Customer, subject to SFDC’s document retention and information security policies and procedures.
standard: The Receiving Party may disclose Confidential Information of the Disclosing Party to the extent compelled by law to do so, provided the Receiving Party gives the Disclosing Party prior notice of the compelled disclosure (to the extent legally permitted) and reasonable assistance, at the Disclosing Party's cost, if the Disclosing Party wishes to contest the disclosure. If the Receiving Party is compelled by law to disclose the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information as part of a civil proceeding to which the Disclosing Party is a party, and the Disclosing Party is not contesting the disclosure, the Disclosing Party will reimburse the Receiving Party for its reasonable cost of compiling and providing secure access to that Confidential Information. In the event Customer does not have access to certain of its Customer Data, SFDC will reasonably cooperate with Customer to provide access to such Customer Data at Customer's expense as it relates to pending or anticipated litigation involving Customer or a government or internal investigation of Customer, subject to SFDC’s document retention and information security policies and procedures.

issue: Customer wants to delete the carve out at the end that reads: “the allegation does not state with specificity that the Services are the basis of the Claim Against Customer;” Option 1
alt_text: SFDC will defend Customer against any claim, demand, suit or proceeding made or brought against Customer by a third party alleging that any Service infringes or misappropriates such third party’s intellectual property rights (a “Claim Against Customer”), and will indemnify Customer from any damages, attorney fees and costs finally awarded against Customer as a result of, or for amounts paid by Customer under a settlement approved by SFDC in writing of, a Claim Against Customer, provided Customer (a) promptly gives SFDC written notice of the Claim Against Customer, (b) gives SFDC sole control of the defense and settlement of the Claim Against Customer (except that SFDC may not settle any Claim Against Customer unless it unconditionally releases Customer of all liability), and (c) gives SFDC all reasonable assistance, at SFDC’s expense. If SFDC receives information about an infringement or misappropriation claim related to a Service, SFDC may in its discretion and at no cost to Customer (i) modify the Services so that they are no longer claimed to infringe or misappropriate, without breaching SFDC’s warranties under “SFDC Warranties” above, (ii) obtain a license for Customer’s continued use of that Service in accordance with this Agreement, or (iii) terminate Customer’s subscriptions for that Service upon 30 days’ written notice and refund Customer any prepaid fees covering the remainder of the term of the terminated subscriptions. The above defense and indemnification obligations do not apply if (1) the allegation does not state, or would otherwise reasonably lead to the conclusion, that the Services are the basis of the Claim Against Customer;  (2) a Claim Against Customer arises from the use or combination of the Services or any part thereof with software, hardware, data, or processes not provided by SFDC, or if the Services or use thereof would not infringe without such combination; (3) a Claim Against Customer arises from Services under an Order Form for which there is no charge; or (4) a Claim Against Customer arises from Content, a Non-SFDC Application or Customer’s breach of this Agreement, the Documentation or an Order Form.
standard: SFDC will defend Customer against any claim, demand, suit or proceeding made or brought against Customer by a third party alleging that any Service infringes or misappropriates such third party’s intellectual property rights (a “Claim Against Customer”), and will indemnify Customer from any damages, attorney fees and costs finally awarded against Customer as a result of, or for amounts paid by Customer under a settlement approved by SFDC in writing of, a Claim Against Customer, provided Customer (a) promptly gives SFDC written notice of the Claim Against Customer, (b) gives SFDC sole control of the defense and settlement of the Claim Against Customer (except that SFDC may not settle any Claim Against Customer unless it unconditionally releases Customer of all liability), and (c) gives SFDC all reasonable assistance, at SFDC’s expense. If SFDC receives information about an infringement or misappropriation claim related to a Service, SFDC may in its discretion and at no cost to Customer (i) modify the Services so that they are no longer claimed to infringe or misappropriate, without breaching SFDC’s warranties under “SFDC Warranties” above, (ii) obtain a license for Customer’s continued use of that Service in accordance with this Agreement, or (iii) terminate Customer’s subscriptions for that Service upon 30 days’ written notice and refund Customer any prepaid fees covering the remainder of the term of the terminated subscriptions. The above defense and indemnification obligations do not apply if (1) the allegation does not state, or would otherwise reasonably lead to the conclusion, that the Services are the basis of the Claim Against Customer;  (2) a Claim Against Customer arises from the use or combination of the Services or any part thereof with software, hardware, data, or processes not provided by SFDC, or if the Services or use thereof would not infringe without such combination; (3) a Claim Against Customer arises from Services under an Order Form for which there is no charge; or (4) a Claim Against Customer arises from Content, a Non-SFDC Application or Customer’s breach of this Agreement, the Documentation or an Order Form.

issue: Issue: Broaden indemnity to Customer’s “use of a Service” infringing intellectual property rights
alt_text: SFDC will defend Customer against any claim, demand, suit or proceeding made or brought against Customer by a third party alleging that Customer's use of any Service infringes or misappropriates such third party’s intellectual property rights (a “Claim Against Customer”), and will indemnify Customer from any damages, attorney fees and costs finally awarded against Customer as a result of, or for amounts paid by Customer under a settlement approved by SFDC in writing of, a Claim Against Customer, provided Customer (a) promptly gives SFDC written notice of the Claim Against Customer, (b) gives SFDC sole control of the defense and settlement of the Claim Against Customer (except that SFDC may not settle any Claim Against Customer unless it unconditionally releases Customer of all liability), and (c) gives SFDC all reasonable assistance, at SFDC’s expense. If SFDC receives information about an infringement or misappropriation claim related to a Service, SFDC may in its discretion and at no cost to Customer (i) modify the Services so that they are no longer claimed to infringe or misappropriate, without breaching SFDC’s warranties under “SFDC Warranties” above, (ii) obtain a license for Customer’s continued use of that Service in accordance with this Agreement, or (iii) terminate Customer’s subscriptions for that Service upon 30 days’ written notice and refund Customer any prepaid fees covering the remainder of the term of the terminated subscriptions. The above defense and indemnification obligations do not apply if (1) the allegation does not state with specificity that the Services are the basis of the Claim Against Customer; (2) a Claim Against Customer arises from the use or combination of the Services or any part thereof with software, hardware, data, or processes not provided by SFDC, or if the Services or use thereof would not infringe without such combination; (3) a Claim Against Customer arises from Services under an Order Form for which there is no charge; or (4) a Claim Against Customer arises from Content, a Non-SFDC Application or Customer’s breach of this Agreement, the Documentation or an Order Form

issue: Broaden indemnity to apply to breaches of SFDC’s confidentiality obligations

issue: Broaden indemnity to apply to breaches of SFDC’s confidentiality and security obligations as described in SPARC Documentation
alt_text: SFDC will defend Customer against any claim, demand, suit or proceeding made made or brought against Customer by a third party (A) alleging that any Service infringes or misappropriates such third party’s intellectual property rights, or (B) arising from SFDC’s failure to maintain the security protections described in the then-current applicable Security Privacy and Architecture Documentation available at help.salesforce.com that results in an unauthorized disclosure of Customer Data (a “Claim Against Customer”), and will indemnify Customer from any damages, attorney fees and costs finally awarded against Customer as a result of, or for amounts paid by Customer under a settlement approved by SFDC in writing of, a Claim Against Customer, provided Customer (a) promptly gives SFDC written notice of the Claim Against Customer, (b) gives SFDC sole control of the defense and settlement of the Claim Against Customer (except that SFDC may not settle any Claim Against Customer unless it unconditionally releases Customer of all liability), and (c) gives SFDC all reasonable assistance, at SFDC’s expense. alt_text: SFDC will defend Customer against any claim, demand, suit or proceeding made or brought against Customer by a third party alleging that any Service infringes or misappropriates such third party’s intellectual property rights or based on SFDC’s negligence with respect to its obligations under this Agreement (a “Claim Against Customer”), and will indemnify Customer from any damages, attorney fees and costs finally awarded against Customer as a result of, or for amounts paid by Customer under a settlement approved by SFDC in writing of, a Claim Against Customer, provided Customer (a) promptly gives SFDC written notice of the Claim Against Customer, (b) gives SFDC sole control of the defense and settlement of the Claim Against Customer (except that SFDC may not settle any Claim Against Customer unless it unconditionally releases Customer of all liability), and (c) gives SFDC all reasonable assistance, at SFDC’s expense. The above defense and indemnification obligations do not apply if (1) the allegation does not state with specificity that the Services are the basis of the Claim Against Customer; (2) a Claim Against Customer arises from the use or combination of the Services or any part thereof with software, hardware, data, or processes not provided by SFDC, or if the Services or use thereof would not infringe without such combination; (3) a Claim Against Customer arises from Services under an Order Form for which there is no charge; or (4) a Claim Against Customer arises from Content, a Non-SFDC Application or Customer’s breach of this Agreement, the Documentation or an Order Form

issue: Customer is concerned that the exclusive remedy language is too broad and limits SFDC’s liability for claims/damages beyond third party claims described in the section.
alt_text: This “Mutual Indemnification” section states the indemnifying party’s sole liability to, and the indemnified party’s exclusive remedy against, the other party for third party claim described in this section. For the avoidance of doubt, the preceding sentence limits the indemnifying party’s liability and the indemnified party’s remedies with respect to third party claims for which there is an indemnification obligation under this Mutual Indemnification section and shall not be interpreted to limit liability or remedies under the Agreement with respect to a breach of the Agreement that has, as one of its consequences, such a third party claim.

issue: Customer wants a higher damage recovery; Option 1:  Add "Under the Agreement"
alt_text: IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF EACH PARTY TOGETHER WITH ALL OF ITS AFFILIATES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT EXCEED THE TOTAL AMOUNT PAID BY CUSTOMER AND ITS AFFILIATES UNDER THE AGREEMENT IN THE TWELVE MONTHS PRECEDING THE FIRST INCIDENT OUT OF WHICH THE LIABILITY AROSE. THE FOREGOING LIMITATION WILL APPLY WHETHER AN ACTION IS IN CONTRACT OR TORT AND REGARDLESS OF THE THEORY OF LIABILITY, BUT WILL NOT LIMIT CUSTOMER'S AND ITS AFFILIATES’ PAYMENT OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE “FEES AND PAYMENT” SECTION ABOVE.

clause_title: Exclusion of Consequential and Related Damages
issue: Carve-out for breaches of confidentiality; Option 1 Mailing
alt_text: IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY OR ITS AFFILIATES HAVE ANY LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT FOR ANY LOST PROFITS, REVENUES, GOODWILL, OR INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, COVER, BUSINESS INTERRUPTION OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, WHETHER AN ACTION IS IN CONTRACT OR TORT AND REGARDLESS OF THE THEORY OF LIABILITY, EVEN IF A PARTY OR ITS AFFILIATES HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES OR IF A PARTY’S OR ITS AFFILIATES’ REMEDY OTHERWISE FAILS OF ITS ESSENTIAL PURPOSE. THE FOREGOING DISCLAIMER WILL NOT APPLY TO THE EXTENT PROHIBITED BY LAW.  NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING TO THE CONTRARY, THE COST OF MAILING LEGALLY REQUIRED NOTICES TO AFFECTED DATA SUBJECTS RESULTING FROM A BREACH BY SFDC OF ITS CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE “CONFIDENTIALITY” SECTION OF THIS AGREEMENT [OR THE PROTECTION OF CUSTOMER DATA SECTION OF THIS AGREEMENT, RESULTING IN THE UNAUTHORIZED DISCLOSURE OF CUSTOMER DATA, THE DATA PROCESSING ADDENDUM, RESULTING IN THE UNAUTHORIZED DISCLOSURE OF PERSONAL INFORMATION AND THE BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ADDENDUM, RESULTING IN THE UNAUTHORIZED DISCLOSURE OF PHI] SHALL BE DEEMED DIRECT DAMAGES.

issue: Strike the automatic renewal provision
alt_text: The term of each subscription shall be as specified in the applicable Order Form. Subscriptions shall not automatically renew. The per-unit pricing during any renewal term will increase by up to 7% above the applicable pricing in the prior term, unless SFDC provides Customer notice of different pricing at least 60 days prior to the applicable renewal term.  Except as expressly provided in the applicable Order Form, renewal of promotional or one-time priced subscriptions will be at SFDC’s applicable list price in effect at the time of the applicable renewal. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, any renewal in which subscription volume for any Services has decreased from the prior term will result in re-pricing at renewal without regard for the prior term’s per-unit pricing.

issue: Allow termination right if SFDC starts storing Customer Data outside of AUSTRALIA, CANADA, EEA, JAPAN, US, as applicable.
alt_text: A party may terminate this Agreement for cause (i) upon 30 days written notice to the other party of a material breach if such breach remains uncured at the expiration of such period, or (ii) if the other party becomes the subject of a petition in bankruptcy or any other proceeding relating to insolvency, receivership, liquidation or assignment for the benefit of creditors. SFDC shall not transfer for storage Customer Data in the Salesforce Services that was originally hosted in [INSERT AUSTRALIA, CANADA, the European Area (being the European Economic Area, the UK and Switzerland), JAPAN OR US] to a storage facility outside the original hosting location without the prior written consent of Customer. In the event that SFDC intends to relocate its hosting facility for storage of Customer Data in Salesforce Services that was originally hosted in the [INSERT AUSTRALIA, CANADA, the European Area, JAPAN OR US] to a storage facility outside the original hosting location, SFDC shall provide Customer with advance written notice. In the event that Customer does not consent to SFDC’s use of a location outside such original hosting location, it shall promptly so notify SFDC, in writing. If SFDC is unable, within 60 days of receiving written notice from Customer, to address Customer’s concern, then Customer may, as its sole and exclusive remedy, terminate the Agreement in its entirety or the Order Forms for the subscriptions impacted by the relocation of the data, and receive a pro-rata refund for any prepaid fees allocable to the period after the effective date of such termination. Customer acknowledges that SFDC may store certain limited Customer Data in other locations for the purposes of operating the Services, as further described in the Trust and Compliance Documentation.
standard: A party may terminate this Agreement for cause (i) upon 30 days written notice to the other party of a material breach if such breach remains uncured at the expiration of such period, or (ii) if the other party becomes the subject of a petition in bankruptcy or any other proceeding relating to insolvency, receivership, liquidation or assignment for the benefit of creditors. SFDC shall not transfer for storage Customer Data in the Salesforce Services that was originally hosted in [INSERT AUSTRALIA, CANADA, the European Area (being the European Economic Area, the UK and Switzerland), JAPAN OR US] to a storage facility outside the original hosting location without the prior written consent of Customer. In the event that SFDC intends to relocate its hosting facility for storage of Customer Data in Salesforce Services that was originally hosted in the [INSERT AUSTRALIA, CANADA, the European Area, JAPAN OR US] to a storage facility outside the original hosting location, SFDC shall provide Customer with advance written notice. In the event that Customer does not consent to SFDC’s use of a location outside such original hosting location, it shall promptly so notify SFDC, in writing. If SFDC is unable, within 60 days of receiving written notice from Customer, to address Customer’s concern, then Customer may, as its sole and exclusive remedy, terminate the Agreement in its entirety or the Order Forms for the subscriptions impacted by the relocation of the data, and receive a pro-rata refund for any prepaid fees allocable to the period after the effective date of such termination. Customer acknowledges that SFDC may store certain limited Customer Data in other locations for the purposes of operating the Services, as further described in the Trust and Compliance Documentation.

clause_title: Entire Agreement and Order of Precedence
issue: Make MSA prevail in the event of a conflict with the Order Form
alt_text: This Agreement is the entire agreement between SFDC and Customer regarding Customer’s use of Services and Content and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, proposals or representations, written or oral, concerning its subject matter. This Agreement supersedes the terms of any online Master Subscription Agreement previously accepted by Customer. The parties agree that any term or condition stated in a Customer purchase order or in any other Customer order documentation (excluding Order Forms) is void. To the extent of any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions in the body of this Agreement and any exhibit or addendum hereto, the terms of such exhibit or addendum shall prevail. To the extent of any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions in the body of this Agreement, the Documentation and any Order Form, the provisions in the body of this Agreement shall prevail except to the extent the conflict relates to pricing, payment terms, or other terms specific to the product(s) or services set forth in such Order Form, in which case such Order Form shall prevail. Titles and headings of sections of this Agreement are for convenience only and shall not affect the construction of any provision of this Agreement.
standard: This Agreement is the entire agreement between SFDC and Customer regarding Customer’s use of Services and Content and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, proposals or representations, written or oral, concerning its subject matter. The parties agree that any term or condition stated in a Customer purchase order or in any other Customer order documentation (excluding Order Forms) is void. To the extent of any conflict or inconsistency between the provisions in the body of this Agreement, the Documentation and any Order Form, the provisions in the body of this Agreement shall prevail except to the extent the conflict relates to pricing, payment terms, or other terms specific to the product(s) or services set forth in such Order Form, in which case such Order Form shall prevail. Titles and headings of sections of this Agreement are for convenience only and shall not affect the construction of any provision of this Agreement.

clause_title: Entire Agreement and Order of Precedence
issue: Customer wants the Agreement to supersede any clickthrough agreements, not just MSA clickthrough agreements
alt_text: This Agreement is the entire agreement between SFDC and Customer regarding Customer’s use of Services and Content and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, proposals or representations, written or oral, concerning its subject matter. This Agreement supersedes the terms of any online Master Subscription Agreement previously accepted by Customer. The parties agree that any term or condition stated in a Customer purchase order or in any other Customer order documentation (excluding Order Forms) is void. In the event of any conflict among the following documents, the order of precedence shall be: (1) the applicable Order Form, (2) any exhibit, schedule or addendum to this Agreement, (3) the body of this Agreement, and (4) the Documentation. Titles and headings of sections of this Agreement are for convenience only and shall not affect the construction of any provision of this Agreement. Any clickthrough or clickwrap agreement presented to Users of a Service will only apply to the extent the terms are specific to the particular product(s) or services to which such terms relate. For clarity, a clickthrough or clickwrap agreement presented to Users in connection with their enablement or use of a product or Service shall not modify the terms of the Agreement generally or present additional terms applicable to products or Services other than the particular product or Service which such User is enabling or using.

issue: Allow Customer to terminate if SFDC is acquired; Direct Competitor
alt_text: Neither party may assign any of its rights or obligations hereunder, whether by operation of law or otherwise, without the other party’s prior written consent (not to be unreasonably withheld); provided, however, either party may assign this Agreement in its entirety (including all Order Forms), without the other party’s consent to its Affiliate or in connection with a merger, acquisition, corporate reorganization, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if a party is acquired by, sells substantially all of its assets to, or undergoes a change of control in favor of, a direct competitor of the other party, then such other party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice. In the event of such a termination, SFDC will refund Customer any prepaid fees covering the remainder of the term of all subscriptions. Subject to the foregoing, this Agreement will bind and inure to the benefit of the parties, their respective successors and permitted assigns. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Customer shall have the right to terminate the Agreement together with all Order Forms hereunder in the event of a change in control of SFDC if the acquiror is a direct competitor of Customer.
standard: Neither party may assign any of its rights or obligations hereunder, whether by operation of law or otherwise, without the other party’s prior written consent (not to be unreasonably withheld); provided, however, either party may assign this Agreement in its entirety (including all Order Forms), without the other party’s consent to its Affiliate or in connection with a merger, acquisition, corporate reorganization, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if a party is acquired by, sells substantially all of its assets to, or undergoes a change of control in favor of, a direct competitor of the other party, then such other party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice. In the event of such a termination, SFDC will refund Customer any prepaid fees covering the remainder of the term of all subscriptions. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Customer shall have the right to terminate the Agreement together with all Order Forms hereunder in the event of a change in control of SFDC if the acquiror is a direct competitor of Customer.

issue: Divestiture Fallback 1 – (Both existing subscriptions and divested subscriptions per unit price increased upon divestiture)
alt_text: Neither party may assign any of its rights or obligations hereunder, whether by operation of law or otherwise, without the other party’s prior written consent (not to be unreasonably withheld). Notwithstanding the foregoing,  (a) either party may assign this Agreement in its entirety (including all Order Forms), without consent of the other party, to its Affiliate or in connection with a merger, acquisition, corporate reorganization, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets not involving a direct competitor of the other party, and (b) SFDC will consent to Customer's assignment of one or more Order Forms (“Divested Subscriptions”) to a divested entity or acquiror (a "Divestiture Assignee") in connection with an asset or business unit divestiture by Customer, provided the Divestiture Assignee has first accepted the terms of SFDC's standard master subscription agreement (whether by signature or electronically), and provided that at the time of the divestiture, the per unit pricing for Customer’s subscriptions remaining as of the date of the divestiture, and the Divested Subscriptions, shall be increased to reflect the reduced volumes applicable to each entity respectively.  The parties shall execute replacement Order Forms accordingly at the time of such divestiture.  If a party is acquired by, sells substantially all of its assets to, or undergoes a change of control in favor of, a direct competitor of the other party, then such other party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice. In the event of such a termination, SFDC will refund Customer any prepaid fees covering the remainder of the term of all subscriptions. Subject to the foregoing, this Agreement will bind and inure to the benefit of the parties, their respective successors and permitted assigns.
standard: Neither party may assign any of its rights or obligations hereunder, whether by operation of law or otherwise, without the other party’s prior written consent (not to be unreasonably withheld). Notwithstanding the foregoing,  (a) either party may assign this Agreement in its entirety (including all Order Forms), without consent of the other party, to its Affiliate or in connection with a merger, acquisition, corporate reorganization, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets not involving a direct competitor of the other party, and (b) SFDC will consent to Customer's assignment of one or more Order Forms (“Divested Subscriptions”) to a divested entity or acquiror (a "Divestiture Assignee") in connection with an asset or business unit divestiture by Customer, provided the Divestiture Assignee has first accepted the terms of SFDC's standard master subscription agreement (whether by signature or electronically), and provided that at the time of the divestiture, the per unit pricing for Customer’s subscriptions remaining as of the date of the divestiture, and the Divested Subscriptions, shall be increased to reflect the reduced volumes applicable to each entity respectively.  The parties shall execute replacement Order Forms accordingly at the time of such divestiture. alt_text: Neither party may assign any of its rights or obligations hereunder, whether by operation of law or otherwise, without the other party’s prior written consent (not to be unreasonably withheld); provided, however, either party may assign this Agreement in its entirety (including all Order Forms), without the other party’s consent to its Affiliate or in connection with a merger, acquisition, corporate reorganization, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if a party is acquired by, sells substantially all of its assets to, or undergoes a change of control in favor of, a direct competitor of the other party, then such other party may terminate this Agreement upon written notice.
